abstract: Denver is confronted with budgetary woes aggravated by esoteric financial deals that Wall Street peddled in the years before the credit crisis.
snippet: Denver is confronted with budgetary woes aggravated by esoteric financial deals that Wall Street peddled in the years before the credit crisis.
lead_paragraph: In the spring of 2008, the Denver public school system needed to plug a $400 million hole in its pension fund. Bankers at JPMorgan Chase offered what seemed to be a perfect solution, Gretchen Morgenson reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Exotic Deals Put Denver Schools Deeper in Debt
